item.title: Rubbish in the lake, 5th January

item.title: Ongoing obstruction of public pavement and waste nuisance, 5th January
item.description:
For over three weeks now, multiple household waste bins and large amounts of rubbish have been left permanently on the public pavement. This has created a serious obstruction for pedestrians and residents. Because of the parking rules in the area we park our cars partially on the pavement, and if a vehicle is parked opposite the bins there is barely any room to pass safely. This is particularly difficult for parents with prams, wheelchair users, and anyone with mobility issues. This situation has persisted for an unreasonable length of time and has not been resolved despite the clear impact on the street and its residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gordon Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice is so bad here still., 5th January
item.description:
The ice is really effecting the Langley court residents Roman way and Tiber way entrance ways. Many cars slipping down the road. And almost slipping into walking residents on the path as I found out today. One car crashed into an electric box on the join from tiber way onto Roman way. The paths are just as bad and I just about got away from the path quick enough as a car slid into the curb. There is no local grit boxes for us to do it ourselves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tiber Way, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice on road causing danger to cyclists, 5th January
item.description:
I've seen two cyclists crash due to ice as they turn left and start cycling up the stretch of Terrace Straight heading towards Anerley Hill (coming from the gym or train station). I couldn't select an accurate location on the map as it redirected me to complain to Crystal Palave Park Trust but it isn't within the boundary of the park. I saw both accidents while walking my dog last night and again today so the fact that I witnessed two accidents when I was only on site for a minute or two each day suggests there is a major problem here. Luckily there were no cars on the road at the time as the cyclists were sent sprawling into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ledrington Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and dog mess, 5th January
item.description:
Fly tipping of bed frame in an area that is a HOTSPOT for fly tipping Dog mess on pavement and outside property that has been spread around (unintentionally be pedestrians) Rubbish bins were not collected properly on last bin day, lots of bags still left there, including one which has now ripped. Dirty nappies on the pavement. Some of this rubbish has not been collected since way before Christmas. Near 139-145 Brookmill Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 143, Brookmill Road, Deptford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another day, another dog turd. Please do something about this ongoing issue., 5th January

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clifden Road, Hackney, London
